original_title: 2023 Halloween Hackfest: Spooky Noise Maker Is Self-Contained
original_content:
We just love it when yall build off of each others projects. This spooky Halloween noise maker from [C.M. Herron] is no exception. But while the projects weve seen lately rely on external computers and/or guitar pedals to create the effects part of the build, this one has everything running on a Raspberry Pi that sits inside the box.
Readers of a certain vintage will recognize this as an 8-track storage box, on top of which are several noise-making objects that creak and ting and reverberate nicely. A USB microphone picks up the sounds, and by using a regular microphone instead of a piezo, [C.M.] can introduce varying levels of feedback to make the sounds even spookier.
So, how did [C.M.] make this work on a Pi 4? To put it simply, theyve got the Reaper DAW and Windows Valhalla plugins running on top of WINE, which running on top of Box64, which is running on top of the Bullseye Pi OS. [C.M.] sure learned a lot from this build, and hopes to inspire others to build their own spooky noise boxen. Plus, theyve already thought of ways to improve it for next year. Be sure to check it out in action after the break.
title: ラズベリーパイで動作するハロウィンの音響装置
body: ハロウィンの音作り装置。Raspberry Piを使って効果を作り出す。古い8トラックボックスの上に装置を置き、USBマイクで音を拾う。さらに、変動するフィードバックで音をもっとおそろしく。要するに、この装置は音作りのためにReaper DAWとWindows Valhallaプラグインを使っている。将来改良する予定も。
titles: ラズベリーパイで動作するハロウィンの音響装置
8トラックストレージボックスを使ったスプーキーなノイズメーカー
USBマイクで音を拾い、さらにリアルな音響効果を追加
ピーゾではなく、レギュラーマイクを使用してフィードバックを調整
音楽制作ソフトウェアとプラグインを組み合わせたパフォーマンス、ラズベリーパイを使用したノイズボックス
